newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: LITHUANIA-SHARES UP, HERMIS IN 20 MLN LITAS DEAL.
newsitem.headline: LITHUANIA-SHARES UP, HERMIS IN 20 MLN LITAS DEAL.

text.p: Lithuanian shares maintained their recent rise on Friday and dealers were cautiously optmistic that foreign interest would lead to further gains next week.
Hermis Bank, the country's second largest private bank, was in the spotlight as 20 million litas worth of its shares changed hands in a block trade.
The official list index, which tracks the top five stocks, rose 13.37 points to 1156.59 while the wider group A index crept up 16.82 points to 1994.65.
Four of the five official list stocks gained with only one easing.
The central market saw 829,000 litas turnover while 20.54 million litas was registered in block trades.
Dealers said that the official list, which has been buoyed by positive results, helped pull up the rest of the market.
"The official list activated trade and I have the feeling that the same will continue next week," Arvydas Jacikevichius, a dealer with Suprema, told Reuters.

Hermis Bank eased slightly to 271.00 litas from 271.10 litas in trade of 110,000 litas on the central market while 20 million litas of its shares were sold in a block trade at prices ranging from 176.30 litas to 272 litas.
Dealers said that 4.7 percent of Hermis shares changed hands.
They could not say who the buyer was but thought it was an institutional foreign investor as few local investors have such funds available.
Rokishkis Cheese rose to 50.22 litas from 49.52 litas in trade worth 245,000 litas.
Dealers said that Rokishkis' promising interim results and good perspectives provide solid grounds for further growth.

"Rokishkis (Cheese) is one of the most stabile companies in the country and it is one of the basic stocks of a Lithuanian investment portfolio," Grazhina Bachiuliene of Vilfima's asset managment firm told Reuters.
Vilniaus Bank rose to 315.10 litas from 310 litas on turnover of 35,000 litas on the central market.
